episodeTitle: A Reunion in Hell?! The Man Who Ate the Chop-Chop Fruit!
episodeTitleJapanese: 地獄で再会！？バラバラの実の実力者！
episodeTitleRomanized: Jigoku de Saikai!? Bara Bara no Mi no Nōryokusha!
description: Hancock uses her powers to smuggle Luffy into Impel Down by petrifying Domino during a body check. On Level 1, Luffy reunites with Buggy the Clown, who agrees to help him navigate the prison in exchange for Captain John's treasure armband.

events.title: Hancock Petrifies Domino
events.description: Boa Hancock uses her Mero Mero no Mi powers to turn Domino and the Surveillance Den Den Mushi to stone before the body check can reveal Luffy clinging to her back. This allows Luffy to successfully infiltrate Impel Down undetected.
events.significance: Critical moment enabling Luffy's infiltration of the world's most secure prison to rescue Ace. Demonstrates Hancock's willingness to risk everything to help Luffy.

events.title: Luffy Says Hancock's Name Correctly
events.description: For the first time, Luffy calls Hancock by her actual name instead of 'Hammock'. Hancock is so moved by this that she falls to the ground swooning, dreaming of marriage with Luffy.
events.significance: Showcases the development of Luffy and Hancock's relationship, and Hancock's deepening feelings for him. This small gesture has a massive emotional impact on Hancock.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy promises not to cause trouble and calls Hancock by her real name for the first time

events.title: Luffy Enters Level 1 Crimson Hell
events.description: Luffy successfully infiltrates Impel Down and arrives on Level 1, known as Crimson Hell. He sees the forest of red trees with blade-like leaves and needle-sharp grass stained red with prisoners' blood.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Luffy's journey through the hellish levels of Impel Down. Level 1 is the first obstacle in his mission to rescue Ace from the world's most secure prison.

events.title: Jean Goen's Debut
events.description: Luffy encounters Jean Goen and his cellmates in Level 1. They are shocked to see someone walking free in the prison. When Luffy explains he came from outside to rescue Ace, they are skeptical but tell him Ace is imprisoned on Level 5.
events.significance: Jean Goen's first appearance. The prisoners provide Luffy with crucial information about Ace's location on Level 5, where high-bounty prisoners are kept.

quotes.text: Ace is locked on Level 5, a block where prisoners with high bounties are held!
quotes.speaker: Jean Goen and Prisoners

events.title: Luffy and Buggy Reunion
events.description: Luffy hears someone crying in distress and discovers it's Buggy the Clown attempting to escape from Level 1. The two are shocked to see each other again after their previous encounters in East Blue.
events.significance: The reunion of Luffy and Buggy marks the beginning of an unlikely alliance that will be crucial for navigating Impel Down. Their past as enemies makes this partnership both comedic and strategically important.

events.title: Blugori Attack Luffy and Buggy
events.description: The Blue Gorillas (Blugori) guards attack Luffy and Buggy. These powerful beasts wield double-sided battle-axes and are strong enough to hunt Sea Kings. Buggy's escape plan is ruined by the encounter.
events.significance: Introduces the Blugori as Level 1's elite guards and forces Luffy and Buggy to work together for the first time, setting up their alliance.

events.title: Luffy's Increased Strength Revealed
events.description: Luffy defeats a Blugori with a single attack and saves Buggy. Buggy is extremely shocked at how easily Luffy defeated the guard, remarking on Luffy's massive improvement since their last encounter in East Blue. Luffy has already defeated all five Blugori before Buggy even realizes it.
events.significance: Demonstrates the significant power increase Luffy has achieved since entering the Grand Line. Shows Buggy (and the audience) how much stronger Luffy has become, foreshadowing his ability to survive deeper levels of Impel Down.

events.title: Buggy and Luffy's Alliance Formed
events.description: Buggy spots the armband Luffy is wearing and immediately recognizes it as the map to Captain John's treasure - something Buggy has been seeking. He proposes a deal: he will escort Luffy to Level 4 of Impel Down in exchange for the armband. Luffy agrees without hesitation.
events.significance: Establishes the alliance between Luffy and Buggy that will be crucial for navigating Impel Down. Captain John's treasure serves as Buggy's motivation, while Luffy gets an experienced guide through the prison. This partnership will have major consequences throughout the Impel Down arc.

quotes.text: I'll escort you to Level 4, but in return you have to give me that armband!
quotes.speaker: Buggy

events.title: Buggy Remembers Shanks
events.description: During the fight with the Blugori, Buggy flashes back to his despising of both Luffy and Shanks. This brief moment reveals his lingering resentment toward Shanks from their past on Roger's crew.
events.significance: Provides character depth for Buggy and reinforces his complex relationship with Shanks, which will continue to be relevant throughout the series.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Calling Hancock by her real name for the first time

quotes.text: Ace is locked on Level 5, a block where prisoners with high bounties are held!
quotes.speaker: Jean Goen and Prisoners

quotes.text: I'll escort you to Level 4, but in return you have to give me that armband!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Proposing the alliance deal to Luffy

themes.description: Former enemies Luffy and Buggy must work together to survive Impel Down, showing how dire circumstances can create strange partnerships.
themes.symbolism: Captain John's treasure armband represents the material motivation that binds even opposing forces together.

themes.description: Hancock risks her position as a Warlord and potentially her freedom to help Luffy infiltrate Impel Down to save Ace, demonstrating the depth of her feelings.
themes.symbolism: Hancock's use of her petrification powers to smuggle Luffy symbolizes how love can make people take extraordinary risks.

themes.description: Luffy's easy defeat of the Blugori showcases how much he has grown since his early adventures in East Blue, shocking even former opponents like Buggy.
themes.symbolism: The Blugori, powerful guards who hunt Sea Kings, serve as a measuring stick for Luffy's growth.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his growth in strength and his determination to rescue Ace at any cost. Shows his trusting nature by immediately agreeing to Buggy's deal.
keyActions: Successfully infiltrates Impel Down with Hancock's help
Calls Hancock by her real name

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his opportunistic nature and obsession with Captain John's treasure. Demonstrates his survival instincts by recognizing Luffy's increased strength and choosing alliance over conflict.
quotes: I'll escort you to Level 4, but in return you have to give me that armband!

characterSpotlights.development: Shows the depth of her feelings for Luffy by risking everything to help him. Her emotional reaction to Luffy saying her name correctly reveals her vulnerability.
keyActions: Petrifies Domino to smuggle Luffy inside
Begs Luffy not to cause trouble
Swoons when Luffy says her name correctly

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 423 covers only the second half of Chapter 526 (pages 7-21), while the first half was covered in Episode 422. The anime may have extended some scenes for pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first time Luffy calls Hancock by her actual name instead of mispronouncing it as 'Hammock'.
Jean Goen's name is a pun on the Japanese word 'goen' meaning fate or destiny, which he discusses with Luffy about his fate in prison.
The episode preview for this episode was notably shorter than usual.
Buggy was imprisoned in Crimson Hell because his Bara Bara no Mi Devil Fruit powers make him immune to the cutting torture of the blade-like leaves.
The armband that Buggy wants is the treasure map to Captain John's treasure, which Luffy obtained from Thriller Bark during the battle with Gecko Moria.
